body.p:
Columbus Ohio Sep 7. 1862
Hon J. F. Robinson

My Bro. J. R. Smith recvd. a commission for 2nd Lieutenancy in 32d Regt -- Ky V. -- ^for recruiting^ aAt the Battle of Cynthiana, on 17th of July last he was taken prisoner, & at the time was acting adjt to my battalion, and paroled by Morgan as a Lieutenant --

He stopped recruiting believing it to be a violation of his parole, after having recruited 14 men for 32nd & over 230 for 7th cavly prior to his having recd commission for recruiting -- My Bro. is here for exchange -- he has done a great deal for the cause, fought well at Cynthiana -- He and my family are exiles & beggers -- and I ask that his commission be confirmed by you -- when exchanged he will immediately report to you in Ky -- I am here by adj Gel. Thomas order, awaiting my exchange, which I think is being
forwarded -- Please answer my request & direct to me at Camp Chase. Ohio. ^Major^ Comdg 2nd Regt of P. P. --
